page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content: Private and Public Transport Most folk find employment and shopping facilities in the nearby larger towns and have at least one car per family. There is also a private car help scheme for the elderly, for visiting doctors, hospitals etc. A limited bus service is available for shopping in Westbury, Trowbridge or Devizes. For longer journeys, there is a main line railway station in Westbury, 4 miles away, but the car is the main form of transport. Despite giving the appearance of being set deep in the countryside, Edington is conveniently placed for easy access to many large towns by car: Salisbury - 30 minutes, Bath 35 minutes, Swindon 40 minutes, and Bristol 50 minutes. For families, the south coast is approx 1 hr 30 minutes and the west coast an hour away.
